review_title: Great place to work, but it can be kind of lonely depending on your job.
job_title: Senior Library Services Associate in Jacksonville, FL
pros: There's a great work atmosphere.  The people there are nice, and the campus is beautiful.  It's a state university, so they can't pay a lot, but they do try to make you feel that you're a valued employee, and as a state employee, you have decent benefits. It's a college campus, so there's always something going on (lectures, concerts, events, etc.).  The students seem more mature here than they do at other universities.  They seem more serious about their studies.  I frequently took walks around the campus during my lunch break, and I rarely saw some of the horseplay and other immature behavior I remember seeing around my college campus during my college days.  Also, as an employee, you get to take one free class a semester.
cons: There weren't that many, and those I can think of aren't horrible.  The pay for my position was low.  The work in my division was of a solitary nature, so there wasn't a need for constant interaction with others in the office in order to get things done.  That could be an issue if you like constant socialization; it wasn't really a problem for me, though it did get a little lonely sometimes.

pros: Good reputation and good benefits
cons: It all depends on which division/department you are in

job_title: Front Desk Gym Staff in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Easy and fun to do
cons: boring at some certain times

pros: The campus is beautiful and is part of a wildlife preserve. The university is young presenting opportunities for innovation. The current president is the former city mayor and has the support and contacts to make positive change. There are many outstanding faculty and staff members.
cons: The Division of Student Affairs is lacking in vision and leadership. Leadership style is more reactionary than proactive. As a result, there is a sense of competitiveness and scarcity of resources rather than collaboration. Also, there is a huge gap between the salaries at the director level and salaries at the coordinator level resulting in a high turnover of staff. Jacksonville is a conventional town with southern traditions and a history of segregation.

review_title: Overall decent employer, but respect needs some work
pros: It is an awesome place for students to work, especially when working with professors in your field of study. It allows you a lot of opportunity to open dialogue with important people and be treated as a peer. The environment allows students to put schoolwork first without criticism or disapproval-- studies are priority.
cons: Resources are limited and difficult to attain when requested, such as access to important documents and maintenance requests. A lot of control is taken away from office workers because there are innumerable hoops to jump through and it hinders the ability to be efficient and make improvements. The politics of making things work is so challenging that things often don't get done in time or done well.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Engineering in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Excellent students, good colleagues. The atmosphere is good for faculty members and it is overall a fine place to work. The pressure to perform in research is relatively low.
cons: No cost of living increases or performance raises for 4 years makes it very difficult to stay, especially if you are a high performer. The salaries are very low compared to other Florida state university system schools. The school is also in the bottom  of the metrics every year, and it brings a feeling of gloom. Unfortunately, the metrics seem to be pushing an overall decrease in rigor, which is unacceptable and unethical in engineering.

review_title: Great overall experience, loved working there and have no regrets.
job_title: Senior Peer Educator to the Department of Health Promotions in Jacksonville, FL
pros: As a student and young man, it offered me the ability to gain leadership experience, interaction skills, communication abilities, and an insight as to how a small department is run and managed. This in turn prepared me for my everyday career and assisted me with taking leadership rolls readily.
cons: There are politics involved within and between departments and finance is always an issue secondary to the fact that departments need to demonstrate their worth on a regular basis. Slightly stressful at times, yet manageable with a level head.

review_title: Change in leadership has negatively affected work environment
pros: Benefits are very good compared to most employers in the region.
cons: Dr. Szymanski has created an environment where long-term faculty and staff feel marginalized and upper level staff especially fear they will be replaced.  He interviewed for the job stating he had an “open door” policy for students, faculty and staff.  Turns out that nothing could be further from the truth.   You must go through layers of people, including vice presidents to get information to him.  Dr. Szymanski does not want his fingerprints on any decision adversely affecting students, faculty or staff.    Pay is also 15 to 25 percent below other public state universities in Florida.

pros: The benefits are good. If you are a budgeted employee, you can take up to 6 credit hours of classes tuition free if you are want to continue your education. Plenty of time off including winter break and spring break. People rarely get fired and there's more job security. Plenty of opportunities to advance into other jobs and it looks good on your resume.
cons: The salaries are low. There are rarely any raises because it depends on if the state wants to allocate money to increasing pay for state workers every fiscal year. Sometimes there is a high turnover rate.

pros: There are lots of opportunities to be involved in University community activities. All functions are open to students as well as staff. Benefits, tuition waivers and work hours are all great. Up to 6 hours per semester are covered after your probation and UNF has a great selection of majors.
cons: Politics politics politics. UNF used to be better but with the new management in the last 10-15 years, the dynamic has changed. Working for the state, we havent had raises in about 5 years and before that, even longer. Hard to stay afloat when the cost of living is going up but your paycheck remains tragically the same.

pros: Great culture, passionate about the experience that the students have. Most staff there are friendly and there to serve the people who they come in contact with.
cons: Pay is lower than other colleges in the state of Florida, some positions on campus are paid lower than what they may receive in other sectors. Must know someone to get ahead.

review_title: UNF offers low pay, but great benefits, although those benefits are being taken away by recent legislation.
pros: UNF offers great benefits - plenty of vacation time, excellent medical and other insurance options, and access to the state's retirement plan. Working at a state institution means low pay, but most of UNF's staff believes in the mission of the University and is happy to be there.
cons: The biggest downside to working at UNF is the pay. No one I know is paid near market value for their experience. Because of state budget cuts to higher education, there is less and less funding, so no one is getting pay increases in the foreseeable future. The state government's cuts to higher ed have also created an increasingly stressful environment for working as more is expected with fewer resources.

job_title: Academic Grader & Class Proctor in Jacksonville, FL
pros:
I worked in the small community of UNF's Department of Mathematics & Statistics under Dr. Scott Hochwald, and always felt very welcomed and appreciated.  As a both an academic grader and class proctor, I experienced flexible work hours, as well as workload accommodations - upon request - during academically demanding times (such as finals week).  The pay was fair - varying with difficulty in class-level.
Those employed in this department (professors, grad students, and students alike) are very passionate about math and statistics, and genuinely enjoy helping others with any material they're knowledgable in; visibly becoming excited when presented with a difficult question.  Great energy and an overall great department to work in.
cons: I can't think of any notable cons I had during my experience working here.

review_title: It Was a Dream Job at First
pros: Excellent benefits and the ability to get vested into the State of Florida's pension plan for your retirement.
cons: Politics, supervisor changes, re-organization of departments, and failure for upper-management to listen to their employees. In addition, the State of Florida's Governor appoints donors, friends, or businessmen to lead the universities in Florida which leads to a real disconnect between the institutions and the bodies that govern them. The entire "metrics" system the Board of Governors recently instated clearly favor UF and FSU and UNF always winds up in the murky middle. Don't expect frequent pay raises, even for merit.

review_title: It's ok if you don't have plans for your life
pros: There are some nice people here. The work is not too demanding and it's a government job.
cons: You'll never get a raise. There seems to be a lot of nepotism at the higher ranks. People switch jobs and titles without the opportunity for others to apply and move up. There is a very real disjointed feeling between the administration and those who work full time. As well as salary discrepancies. Check the state of florida educational salary, it's free.  You'll see how under appreciated the employees are as a whole.

pros: As promotions director I was allowed plenty of freedom. You get to take the work as far out as you can imagine with no budget.
cons: It was unclear as to what boundaries I had in my position until someone would get angry with me over something I had no idea I did wrong. We mended this by putting policies and best practices documents out. Hard group to please but if you stick around long enough they're alright, or they graduate.

review_title: I had a great experience at UNF, and if you get a chance to do a RA then you should.
pros: If you get on with the right project, you can be involved with outstanding research. In addition to the research, the project you work on will usually cover your tuition, and at the end of your research the professor can be instrumental in landing a first job.
cons: The head of the college I'm in at UNF needs to be removed. The politics are so bad, that it's affecting the research and creating an environment where people want to leave.

pros:
Great environment.
Reviews keep saying low pay - what they don't understand is that the compensation structure  is so random and run by the individual departments that there is no internal equity. HR won't stand up to the challenge of fixing it - which would save hundreds of thousands of dollars on the total budget.  Overall, the salaries would be fair, and great benefits. So as a compensation package - great!  It just needs to be communicated properly.
cons: Lack of compensation structure and communication to employees.

review_title: Good for gaining professional experience but ideally this is where you work when you're close to retiring.
pros: Good time off, sick leave and paid holidays. 1 1/2 weeks of Christmas break and 4 days of Spring break. 3 credits of free education per semester for yourself, dependents or spouse. Discounts and perks on the HR website.
cons: All the salaries are really low. No room for advancement without further education. No raises at all. There is no such thing as office coffee, water, food, etc. because it is a State agency. No interaction between departments.

pros: Public sector job, stable salary; Great health and retirements benefits as a state employee; Location is close to the beach and St. John's County
cons: School places a premium on teaching over research, so teaching evaluations are very important; But most students are lazy and/or bogged down with jobs and extracurricular activities yet still take a full courseload; Like most universities, the administration is not interested in holding students accountable for plagiarism or cheating; Departments vary with respect to how much they support assistant professors working toward tenure. Some don't provide much support at all.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The campus is beautiful and usually there is plenty of parking.  There are at least 3 coffee shops on campus which is great.  Campus environment is always nice to be in.
cons: In my department, professors were not good managers.  Otherwise everything was great. The only other con is that there are always police with radar eager to catch speeders.

pros: This is a great place to work for self growth. As a student attending the university this was a great place to meet lots of new people and find yourself along the way!
cons: A lot of time commitment and not enough compensation. It is important to stay on everyone's good side too, as there tends to be a lot of drama!

review_title: It was a good place to start my career. I was able to gain full time work experience while getting my Master's degree.
pros: The ability to take classes for free is a great benefit. There is also good job security working for the university.
cons: There is little room for professional growth and career advancement. The pay is not great.

pros: The University really likes to promote from within and is always wanting to help you with your career. The University also pays for classes you would like to take at the University (2 classes per semester). Great environment to work within. Insurance, benefits, and time off are all GREAT!
cons: The University has been on a raise freeze for 4 years but this is made up for by the time given off over holiday breaks.

review_title: Nice campus with great benefits/perks but very low pay and doesnt treat employees how they should!!!
pros: Benefits, perks, nice campus, location is great!
cons: Horrible low salarys/pay, very unflexiable and inconsiderate with important family matters especially when they claim to be a family oriented,   friendly university.

review_title: A stepping stone for general mechanics to learn the basics of maintenance.
pros: Having the latest in H VAC/ R equipment to learn on and the diversity in cross training between electrical and plumbing rounding off the maintenance mechanic experience.
cons: Unable to compete with the open market on salary.

pros: Job location is central, campus layout is fine, student body, work office environment is quiet,  good co-workers, easy access to campus food areas, normal 8 to 5 working hours
cons: Parking is not adequate for both commuting students and university employees, management behavior,  departmental administrative personnel not following purchasing guidelines,

pros: Working at UNF has a community feel to it. Full-time positions come with a lot of benefits including great heath insurance, free gym membership, tuition reimbursement, etc.
cons: The hierarchy at UNF is out of control. Pay is only so-so with not a lot of chances for it to improve.

pros: Some departments are fine, others are horrible.  Ambivalent students don't place much demand on profs - the less work you give them the happier they are.  Great location.
cons: Mediocre administration going all the way up to the president. Students would rather be somewhere else.  Weak Faculty Union.  Florida state has a weak commitment to education in general.

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros:
1. Very Flexible Hours
2. Friendly Staff
3. On the job training 
4. Opportunities for growth if you apply yourself.
5. Interact with all types of clients ; both faculty and staff.
cons:
1. At times it is very short staffed. 
2. During rush season ( beginning of the semester ) there is lots of work to do.
3. Lazy coworkers at times.

review_title: Good for stable income and minimal stress
pros: The environment is pretty relaxed since it is a small public university. There are some great benefits and employee discounts available for those who work here.
cons: Their accounting system is pretty old. Could use better training and team building techniques for better office culture. Compensation is better for the higher ups. Not much opportunity for growth.

pros: Great people, Positive environment, not a lot of micro-management, good benefits.
cons: The pay is the biggest con here. No raises even with exemplary annual performance reviews.

review_title: Great Place if You're Starting Your IT Career
job_title: ITS Help Desk Assistant in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The people you work with are very helpful, friendly and willing to communicate. The team consist of young innovative techs and seasoned technicians as well.
cons: The pay is relatively low. If you are a college student it's a great opportunity! But if you are a season worker, it would probably be better for you to find somewhere with higher pay.

pros: As you get to know people across departments, it becomes a family. Hours are superb as well as the holidays that are in aligned with Duval County Public Schools.
cons: It is is a little tough to get your foot in the door for a full time position, but once you get to know more faculty and staff, people begin to recommend you.

pros: Great university if you work in the right department.
cons: Poor pay in comparison with other state universities. Administration is all about quantity vs quality. Poor work environment in Enrollment Services - upper management doesn't respect personal time or work/life balance.

pros: With it being such a small University, you are able to dabble in different aspects and learn more about other departments.
cons: Very cheap, they do not pay good hours/salary because they are trying to save money and it comes back and bites them in the you know what. People leave and get a reasonable salary somewhere else.

review_title: Club Alliance position in Student Gov.
pros: Relaxed, laid back, fun atmosphere, freedom to be creative. I had a nice desk in front of a large window. Everyone was friendly. Flexible hours.
cons: Too much free time. It's like they didn't actually have enough work for me to do. Also, my superiors weren't so great at reaching out.

pros: Many good people work here, the benefits are very good, it's a growing school vital to the community, decent resources
cons: Run like a business not a public academic institution. People look out for themselves most of the time.

job_title: Laboratory Support Specialist in Jacksonville, FL
pros: It's a small university (about 18,000 students) comparing to other schools near by like UF, FSU, UCF & USF where they are probably at least 45,000 or 50,000 students!
cons: Since it is still considered a small school, there are not a whole lot of stuff going on comparing to other big and older universities.

job_title: Coordinator, Administrative Services in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Benefits, coworkers and overall work environment are all wonderful.
cons: Different managers are over each department, so they vary across campus.  Not all bosses are created equal.

pros: Very good schedule for part time and good pay for the amount of work involved.
cons: The main con is that there seems to be a lot of financial waste on the part of school administration. Some programs should be reduced or eliminated.

pros: Great place to work.  Nice environment with very diverse set of employees and students.
cons: Not many.  Only real con is that like any other large employer, often politics can affect day to day work.

pros:
- Some free time during work and a very relaxed environment
- Got to work on personal projects
- Deepen Knowledge on many aspects
cons:
- Awful pay rate and dumb tasks occasionally.
- No career to follow
- No Raises

pros: Good benefits gorgeous campus as well as other people around campus friendly atmosphere
cons: The bosses are rude and the staff is very petty the supervisors are good for nothing and the pay is blah and it's a lot of blatherskites with nothing to do and all this is in the cleaning filed and they work you like a slave with no mercy 🙍SMH not a good place to work at all!!

review_title: Don't work  for the housing office.
pros: Its fun to interacting with the students, and the job was easy.
cons: The housing office has to be one of the worst establishments I have ever worked for. They also make you work on holidays without extra pay.

pros:
The benefits are amazing.
Management wants you to succeed, and will allow for numerous training opportunities to enhance performance skills.
cons:
The pay is below average. You definitely are not going to get rich as an employee at UNF.
Parking is awful, and they even make their employees pay for parking.

pros: UNF is a great organization. As a state employee, you enjoy great benefits such as paid leave, retirement, and many other perks.
cons: As a state employee there are also very tight restrictions on things such as pay increases, hiring, processes, retirement vesting, etc.

pros: Smaller teaching-focused university with a beautiful campus. Great benefits including lots of paid time off and free credits each semester.
cons: Really low salaries and not many opportunities for merit-based pay raises or advancement.

review_title: I had a very rewarding career at UNF
pros: I worked for the best Director on campus.  She always encouraged me to take the opportunity for any type of training that would assist me in my daily duties.
cons: Not a lot of advancement opportunities

review_title: satisfying for starting out in a career, developing, bureaucratic
pros: great environment, training opportunities, educational opportunities, good time off (spring break, winter break, holidays)
cons: low salary, bureaucratic, state reduction in budgets

job_title: Research Assistant/IT Analyst in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Colleagues are friendly. They respect your ideas and are willing to work with you. Pay is decent. It is a good organization to learn and experiment with.
cons: The workplace can be laid back at times. Work can be delayed and may not be impromptu always.

review_title: Only work here if Higher Ed is your main goal.
job_title: Web Services Specialist in Jacksonville, FL
pros: You get higher educational experience and it's a good right out of college job due to the benefits.
cons: There are no raises or upper mobility unless you are willing to be cut throat and a "boss's pet".

review_title: Spinnaker is a great place to work
pros: Relaxed dress code, flexible hours, great co-workers and place to learn how to do a new position. I was
cons: Some of the policies are a bit bureaucratic, but that's to be expected at any large organization.

review_title: Conflicts in upper management and poor communication leaves other employees confused
pros:
- Lovely, small campus
- Lots of available positions
cons: - A lot of new school  vs old school infighting with the upper management

job_title: Equal Opportunity and Diversity Coordinator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The faculty and staff are great in collaborating and working on projects. My boss was a mentor and taught me a lot. The HR Department is awesome!
cons: There are no Cons that I can think of.

pros: Good place to work, the people you meet and your co-workers are nice for the most part. Physical Facilities is always hiring.
cons: The pay and the fact that 90 percent of the time you are short handed.

pros: Campus is small which makes it nice for students
cons:
Student support is lacking in terms of advisement and tutoring
Thinking outside the box for recruitment is frowned upon
Programs that are in demand being cut by administration or not pursued

pros: Very helpful when it came to scheduling, willing to work around my class schedule, accommodating, great pay, manager very easy to get along with
cons: not a lot of hours available for this position

pros:
Very friendly coworkers
Always appreciative of hard work
Good way to meet alumni of UNF and make connections
cons:
Not a lot of designers there
Sometimes hard to get designs approved by multiple parties

review_title: If you like being part of a family, this is the place to work!
pros:
Great benefits
Always treated like family 
Tons of professional development 
Administration attends events, as opposed to hiding in their offices
cons:
Low pay 
Paid parking

pros: good benefits, non-stressful job, family friendly
cons: lack of promotions, make sure to get the salary you want before you get hired

pros: Great campus and programs, awesome people.
cons: Low pay compared to other schools. Authorized to give pay raises and was declined and gave employees of 3 years or more a one time bonus.

pros: The University is located in a nice place, it's small and everyone is freindly.
cons: They don't give bonuses or raises, most staff consists of college kids, so they treat their staff the in the same manor.

pros: Professors help a lot, and they have many projects in which you can do research, so you can choose the one that fits you best.
cons: There is not anything that is bad.

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Very Chill, nice people, a lot of IT help desk information to learn
cons: Sometimes it is difficult to get help on a difficult issue and of course regular customer service issues.

pros:
Learn to work with different people
Able to work in a friendly environment
Enjoy the workplace
Open to suggestions
cons:
Need more step by step guidance for new employees
Can be confusing as to what is done

review_title: Academia is political but making your own hours is great.
pros: You can set your own hours.
cons: Politics. Keep your head down.

review_title: Good place to work, but not a place to stay unless you are in higher education
pros: Good for entry level; good work balance; nice people;
cons: Small compensation; some inner office politics;

job_title: Help Desk Technical Assistant in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Flexible to class schedules, full time opportunities, fun work environment
cons: Seniority rule when in many cases it shouldn't

review_title: A nice place to work and study.
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great faculty and student environment.
cons: Not having a chemistry graduate program meant that undergraduate researchers were not mentored by grad and postdoc scientists.

pros: UNF is truly a family of diverse individuals working hard to create brighter paths in higher education.
cons: Nothing bad that I can think to share.

job_title: Program Assistant, the Graduate School in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good benefits, perks, great environment
cons: very low pay, disorganized, not well-defined roles

job_title: Purchasing Associate in Atlantic Beach, FL
pros: Lots of time off during the holidays
cons: To menial and low pay. No room for growth and there are not many young people that work at this university.

pros: flexible scedule, great co workers, able to socialize and network with different people.
cons: management isnt professional, no work consistency, unstable work environment. no advancement

job_title: Research Associate in University Of, FL
pros: A lot of down time. Keeps you fresh for the GRE/MCAT.
cons: A lot of down time.

review_title: Military Veterans Resource Center Work Study
job_title: Work Study Student in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Student environment diverse in age, gender, military affiliation, and degree majors.
cons: Bring headphones if you plan on deep stuying

pros: small university benefits of a more personal connection in classes
cons: They do not have a football team

pros:

cons: Nothing I can think of

pros: Great hours, very flexible with course work.
cons: Early AF shifts, no other cons. It was pretty tight driving the cart around.

pros: Met some great people while working here.
cons: Pay is a little on the lower side, sometimes scheduling can be rough.

pros: Flexibility with the schedule was a pro.
cons: The pay was absolutely horrible, 3 years and no pay raise.

job_title: Senior IT Support Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Plenty of room for growth. They prefer to promote internally.
cons: The pay is lower than private sector equivalent.

pros: Hours are very flexible and the people are welcoming.
cons: Not too many opportunities for a single sport.
